Key Match Events: India posted their highest total against Bangladesh in the second T20I
Nitish Kumar Reddy and Rinku Singh added 108 for the fourth wicket
Hardik Pandya and Riyan Parag struck meaty blows at the death
Taskin Ahmed took 2 for 16 in Delhi
Mustafizur Rahman was wily as usual
Tanzim Hasan Sakib showed his growing skills
Pre-Game Insights: India could give a chance to Ravi Bishnoi, Tilak Verma, Jitesh Sharma and Harshit Rana
Mahmudullah was the only Bangladesh batter to make a substantial score in the second T20I
India will be keen to stretch their dominance against Bangladesh
Bangladesh have batted woefully and bowled well only in certain periods
India displayed their heightened T20 skills
India now have the option to test the rest of the squad after going unchanged in the first two games
Bangladesh's top order hasn't given them the best of starts
Top order and spinners must get their act together for the visitors to have one last chance to at least threaten the hosts on this tour
Nitish Kumar Reddy has slotted right into India's template of being an attacking batting unit
Mahmudullah will be playing his last T20I for Bangladesh
Bangladesh have a long discussion ahead of them to replace Mahmudullah in the T20I side
Ravi Bishnoi, Tilak Verma, Jitesh Sharma and Harshit Rana could get a run in Hyderabad
Bangladesh may bring in Mahedi Hasan in place of Jaker Ali
Miscellaneous Highlights: India stretched their unbeaten run in the bilateral T20I series at home to 16 after beating Bangladesh by 86 runs in Delhi
In IPL 2024, Abhishek Sharma struck 284 runs, including three fifties, at a strike rate of 249.12 in Hyderabad
In Delhi, India used seven bowlers and each took at least one wicket
Bangladesh's spinners conceded 14.75 runs per over in Delhi, their most expensive collective performance in a T20I when they bowled a minimum of five overs
